newsitem.title: GERMANY: Munich Re- no plans to cut Allianz stake. [Corrected 14:45 gmt]
newsitem.headline: Munich Re- no plans to cut Allianz stake. [Corrected 14:45 gmt]

text.p: German reinsurance group Muenchener Rueckversicherungs AG, or Munich Re, said on Monday it had no plans to reduce its 25 percent stake in fellow insurance giant Allianz AG Holding.

Management board chairman Hans-Juergen Schinzler told a news conference that the sale of the Allianz stake would yield around 15 billion (corrects from "50 billion") marks ($9.97 billion), but that this would be cut by more than half by tax charges.
"Then we would have to invest that money somewhere that would give us a better yield than Allianz, and we haven't found that," Schinzler said.
Moreover, Munich Re had no wish to make any changes in its long-standing relationship with Allianz, of which shareholdings formed a crucial part, he added.
However Schinzler said Munich Re and Allianz might get involved in a share swap in the U.S. as a result of Munich Re's decision this year to take over American Re.

Allianz owns 40 percent of Munich American Reinsurance Company, which is to be merged with American Re and may decide not to transfer this holding into a significantly smaller stake in American Re, Schinzler said.
"Nothing has been decided but if Allianz does decide to do this (pull out), then it is possible that we might swap that stake for shares in Allianz North America," he said.
